title: Adult Social Care faces £5m funding cuts | Border
text:
Cumbria County Council Credit: ITV Border Cumbria County Council says it will have to save a further £17.5m of cuts by 2016/17, of which £5m is expected to come from the Adult Social Care budget.
The council has today launched a public consultation to discuss where the cuts will fall.
The three areas up for discussion are:
'The Integrated Risk Management Plan' - Where the Council will discuss the possibility of closing a number of retained fire stations. 'The Adult Social Care Commissioning Strategy' - To discuss the funding cuts to Adult Social Care. 'The Extra Care Housing Strategy' - The council wants a 'significant further increase' in the number of extra care housing, which is part of the Adult Social Care budget. Extra care housing includes the use of individual housing compared with the traditional care home model. 'Extra are Housing' includes the use of individual housing compared with the traditional care home model, and is considered a cheaper option for the council.
